address.data

Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • address.data.AddressBook
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Event

    public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    AddressBook class contains the vectors that stores the address entries.
    Author:
    Jialiang Zhong

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentHighestID
      Holds the ID int to be used for the next AddressEntry ID.
      protected java.util.Vector<AddressEntry> entryList
      Holds AddressEntry in a vector

      void addEntry(AddressEntry entry)
      Takes an entry and adds it to the vector list and increments the total address count
      int getHighestCurrentID()
      Gets the integer for the next AddressEntry ID to be assigned.

      Returns the entry list.
      void list()
      Sorts the address vector and prints out each entry
      void loadFromDataBase()
      Clear the AddressBook vector and fills it with data from the MYSQL database.

      Takes an entry and searches for it in the address vector and removes it and decrements the total address count

      void SortList()
      Sorts the AddressBook vector
      void writeToDataBase()

        public void writeToDataBase()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            java.lang.InstantiationException,
                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Connects to MYSQL database and removes everything within it. Then fills it up with the data in the AddressBook Vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • loadFromDataBase

        public void loadFromDataBase()
                      throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        Clear the AddressBook vector and fills it with data from the MYSQL database. Generates AddressEntry IDs for the purposes of keeping track of notes in a separate table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
